alpha.meaning: Significance level for conditional independence tests
alpha.reasoning: Higher values (e.g., 0.1) for small samples (<500) to avoid missing true dependencies. Lower values (e.g., 0.01) for large samples (>10000) to reduce false positives. Use 0.05 for moderate sample sizes (500-10000).

is_discrete.meaning: Whether the data contains discrete variables
is_discrete.reasoning: Set to true for discrete or mixed data to use appropriate independence tests. Set to false for purely continuous data to use tests optimized for continuous variables.
